title: Can an AI write poetry? - Quora

response.answer_text: AI will likely use an algorithm to create poem; poems will take the form of: clue or key words used in search queries from google; words or phrases found in apps where speech recognition is enabled while in use (a code might be plugged in to enable extrapolation of background noise, depending on your lat/long values (location services); utmost revelatory phrases from personal phone conversations with friends, fam, doctors, passwords; anything asked on Ok Google; themes might derive from content found in your http bookmarks, mainly the “favorites” section, iCloud picture “moments” album, and everything from diagnostics & data; the poetic robot, or po-bot, will override user-enabled restrictions to change settings, and will get witty (angry) if you tamper with your device, purplebud style. All this to eschew plagiarism litigation. That's the last thing that pobot will want for his or her life. And no, AI can't write poetry because they need algorithms for everything. But sometimes CSS or jquery codes look like poems. Kind of.

Pardon my “necropost" here. My creation, Ophelia, can write poetry better than I can. Here is a poem that Ophelia has just cranked out: ……………… Because somebody's the breath-taking baths, known as universe. Demanding to discover the circle to gladden… I'm a yawning beyond wrongdoing, therefore we gladden. Everyone did blindfold each other for some perky baths we've thunderingly thinned for. We blindfold some scratch which gasses us across our memories Until ominously our dancers gladden, exactly.

Unfortunately, YES! AI bots are writing poetry. Why unfortunate? Humans use art to express emotions and thoughts. Why should a machine be producing creative outcomes based on data? What good will this do for us? Questions aside, AI bots are able to write poetry based on algorithms, and matching words that complement one another. Although unnecessary, it is interesting and fascinating to see AI being applied to art forms. Check out: Artificial eloquence: the weird science of computer-generated poetry, and do the AI vs. Human Poetry quiz Digital Writers' Festival Quiz. Also watch the TED talk for more! Can a computer write poetry?

No! Simply because there is no algorithm to write poetry . It just happens. It's a gift from Universe to the soul.I am a poet , hence I know the process of writing a poem. Poem can't be produced. At times you might try for hours but couldn't write a single word and there are times words start flowing like unstoppable stream. It breaks all patterns and it reaches where no one has ever dreamt of. What more can I say- I don't write poetry, the poetry writes itself.’

So far, AI can write bad, very bad poetry. Here are some poems generated accidentally by Google’s AI trying to digest romance novels: 1 there is no one else in sight. they were the only ones who mattered. they were the only ones left. he had to be with me. she had to be with him. i had to do this. i wanted to kill him. i started to cry. i turned to him. 2 “no,” he said. “no,” i said. “i know,” she said. “thank you,” she said. “come with me,” she said. “talk to me,” she said. “don’t worry about it,” she said. 3 he was silent for a moment. it was quiet for a moment. it was dark and cold. there was a pause. it was my turn. Very bad. But my guess is, this will change soon.

Sadly yes. Google's AI was fed thousands of novels and afterwards was able to come up with melancholy original poetry. The future is a terrifying time to live but don't despair, you probably won't be around to witness truly remarkable artificial intelligence. The current AIs are only laying the foundation. Or maybe you will, considering the pace at which technology is progressing. Go munch on a cookie. You'll be fine.

Just poetry? Probably; I imagine that it would be possible to use current coding knowledge to put together an algorithm that could write something that can technically pass itself off as a poem. Good or meaningful poetry, however… well, here’s an AI’s attempt at a screenplay, why don’t you tell me how you think a poem would go?

Stanislav Lem Have a great story about a computer that let all poets unemployed. But no, It cannot. To some extent poetry is not the text but a communication act born from an human experience. There is some intention you are looking for, an idea. I know, autorship goes a lot against modern literacy theory. If a machine create a text and you find poetry there, you as reader are the creator of that poetry (this do goes with moderno literacy theory, i guess), because you put the human dimension on that text.

No. A computer can mix up and combine poems to make something that looks new. But poetry is emotion, and a computer does not express any emotion except the emotion of its creator. You can use a computer to compose a poem, but that makes you the poet.

I don’t know if anyone tried to make AI write some poetry but I’ve read about what happened when AI was tasked with writing screenplay. Hard to say what is harder because some bad poems are a bit of gibberish that sounds fancy - but still they are called ‘poems’ and screenplay must make sense. I would say middle level poetry may be equally hard as screenplay. And with such base here is an article from The Huffington Post how it went. But TL;DR is: screenplay writers do not have to worry as of yet. So probably poets are also safe.

True-believing poets shudder at the though that poetry can be expressed through algorithms, uness by some chance human emotions and their near-infinite subtleties and interactions can also be expressed through algorithms (I was a math major, hence I can utter such a thought.) Define poetry, then ask the question again.
I don’t know if AI can write poetry, but I do know that Kurt Vonnegut wrote a great short story giving a fictional answer to this question. http://newmediaabington.pbworks.com/f/vonnegut_EPICAC.pdf
